"People who took the vaccines for the first time took a genetic injection of foreign genetic material that produced in their body for an uncontrolled duration [of] time and quantity, the Wuhan spike protein, the protein on the surface of the virus that causes so much damage in the human body." "Many of you still have the spike protein in your cells and your tissues," detailed [McCullough](https://petermcculloughmd.substack.com/p/breaking-clinical-rationale-for-sars?r=14jb45&utm_medium=ios&utm_campaign=post). "Every study that's looked at this has actually identified this central issue. The human body does not seem to have enzymes that can break down this protein like it could any other natural protein and have us get rid of it." Why? "It's because this protein is not natural," answered [McCullough](https://petermcculloughmd.substack.com/p/breaking-clinical-rationale-for-sars?r=14jb45&utm_medium=ios&utm_campaign=post). "It was engineered in a Chinese biosecurity lab using blueprints that came from US researchers fully-funded and supported by the National Institutes of Health and the National Allergy Immunology branch run by Dr. Anthony Fauci." The effects of the unnatural spike protein have been devastating. "That is a huge number." "Now, fortunately, about a third of people who took the vaccine, they've had no side effects whatsoever, and they appear to be exhibiting no side effects emerging. So, if one took the shot and they're perfectly fine, didn't even have a sore arm, they're extremely unlikely now to develop a problem," explained [McCullough.](https://petermcculloughmd.substack.com/p/breaking-clinical-rationale-for-sars?r=14jb45&utm_medium=ios&utm_campaign=post) "But it's people who developed an initial reaction and were sick for a few days or weeks afterwards — I really worry about them because we are seeing the late development of myocarditis and cardiac arrest even two years after the vaccine. So, what can we do to help prevent such medical disasters? Three words: " [Base Spike Detoxification](https://www.jpands.org/vol28no3/mccullough.pdf)," [McCullough](https://petermcculloughmd.substack.com/p/breaking-clinical-rationale-for-sars?r=14jb45&utm_medium=ios&utm_campaign=post) announced historic day" because "the [very first detoxification protocol](https://www.jpands.org/vol28no3/mccullough.pdf) was published in the US medical literature." Specifically, the Journal of American Physicians and Surgeons. [McCullough](https://petermcculloughmd.substack.com/p/breaking-clinical-rationale-for-sars?r=14jb45&utm_medium=ios&utm_campaign=post) explained that this [detoxification protocol](https://www.jpands.org/vol28no3/mccullough.pdf) allows individuals to proactively address the issue head-on by using three natural substances, nattokinase, bromelain, and curcumin, which are available over-the-counter, "to help the body clear this very dangerous protein from [their] cells and tissues." Although the protocol has not yet been scientifically validated through double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled trials, [McCullough](https://petermcculloughmd.substack.com/p/breaking-clinical-rationale-for-sars?r=14jb45&utm_medium=ios&utm_campaign=post) argued that clinical observations indicate a positive impact. What Are Nattokinase, Bromelain, and Curcumin? Nattokinase: An enzyme derived from the fermentation of soy. It has been traditionally used in Japan for its supposed cardiovascular benefits. Preclinical trials show it degrades the spike protein. Bromelain: A set of enzymes derived from pineapple stems, approved by the FDA as a topical treatment for wounds. Like nattokinase, it has also been shown to accelerate the clearance of spike proteins. Curcumin: The active compound in turmeric, widely used for its anti-inflammatory properties. It also mitigates further damage from the spike protein. He said he has observed people experience relief from symptoms such as numbness, tingling, heart racing, headaches, and loss of senses under this protocol. However, these observations have not yet been supported by large-scale scientific trials.
